conclusion: The green toy vehicle (A) enters from the lower-right edge on a left-upward (north-west) trajectory.
The marble is positioned slightly above and left of the vehicle’s starting point.
The first object the vehicle meets on its trajectory is the marble.
The marble is round and can roll.
After the impact, the marble absorbs part of A’s momentum and is pushed up-left a short distance.
The vehicle is much more massive and rolls on wheels.
The vehicle continues almost straight but with a very small leftward deflection caused by the glancing blow on the marble.
A yellow cube is lying a little farther up-left from the marble.
The modified path of the vehicle makes it run into the yellow cube.
The yellow cube is light and can slide.
The yellow cube slides several centimetres, while A loses most of its remaining speed and turns a bit more to the left.
After the second collision, the vehicle is almost out of kinetic energy and stops a few centimetres beyond the yellow cube.
The central lower part of the setup is near the final rest position of the vehicle.
Objects hit (in order): the marble first, then the yellow cube.
Final rest position of A: just past the yellow cube, near the centre-bottom of the cloth.
